text: Erigeron piperianus is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family known by the common name Piper's fleabane. It has been found only in the state of Washington in the northwestern United States.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Erigeron piperianus is a small perennial herb rarely more than 12 centimeters (4.8 inches) tall, producing a woody taproot. The plant generally produces only 1 flower head per stem. Each head has 25–40 yellow ray florets surrounding numerous yellow disc florets. The plant grows in dry, open, relatively flat land, often with sagebrush.Flora of North America, Erigeron piperianus Cronquist, 1947.
